conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas, calculate the work done in each segment and sum them up.
Work done by the gas in a cyclic process is the area under the p-V curve.
Segment A to B is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
Segment B to C is an isochoric process (constant volume).
Segment C to A is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
Calculate work done in segment A to B: Pressure is constant, volume change is zero, so work done is 0.
Calculate work done in segment B to C: Volume is constant, so work done is 0.
Calculate work done in segment C to A: Pressure is constant, volume changes from 2 L to 5 L, work done is 3 x 10^5 J.
Sum the work done in all segments: Total work done is 3 x 10^5 J.
